decoder

Class IntermediateNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • decoder.AbstractNode
      • decoder.IntermediateNode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TreeNode

    public class IntermediateNode
extends AbstractNode
    A class that represents nodes in tree that have children. Have same operations as a TreeNode.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class decoder.AbstractNode

        code

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      IntermediateNode()
      Constructor to create an empty Intermediate Node Object.
      IntermediateNode(java.lang.Character code)
      Constructor to create an Intermediate Node Object.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      TreeNode addChild(TreeNode tree)
      Method to add a child to an intermediate node.
      boolean isCodeComplete(int size)
      Given a size checks if this node has number of children equal to the size parameter passed and checks if its children also have number of children equal to the size parameter passed, it returns false if check fails for any node, and if passes for every node, returns true.
      TreeNode returnNode(TreeNode tree)
      Given a node with a character code, returns this node if the character code in this node equals the code of the node passed to the function.

      • Methods inherited from class decoder.AbstractNode

    • Constructor Detail

      • IntermediateNode

        public IntermediateNode()
        Constructor to create an empty Intermediate Node Object.

      • IntermediateNode

        public IntermediateNode(java.lang.Character code)
        Constructor to create an Intermediate Node Object. Creates an empty list of Treenode to keep track of its Children.
        Parameters:
        code - the code at the node.

    • Method Detail

      • addChild

        public TreeNode addChild(TreeNode tree)
        Method to add a child to an intermediate node. If a child treenode with the code is already present, the treenode is returned else, the treenode with code is added as a child to the Intermediate Node.
        Parameters:
        tree - a treenode with the code to be added to the intermediate node
        Returns:
        an already existing tree node with given code or create a new tree node and return it.

      • returnNode

        public TreeNode returnNode(TreeNode tree)
        Given a node with a character code, returns this node if the character code in this node equals the code of the node passed to the function. If not, it checks for the same with all its children and if such a node doesn't exist even then, throws an IllegalStateException.
        Parameters:
        tree - the node with character to be checked for in the tree.
        Returns:
        the node with code equal to the code of the parameter passed.

      • isCodeComplete

        public boolean isCodeComplete(int size)
        Given a size checks if this node has number of children equal to the size parameter passed and checks if its children also have number of children equal to the size parameter passed, it returns false if check fails for any node, and if passes for every node, returns true.
        Parameters:
        size - value against which check is made.
        Returns:
        boolean value according to if the check passes or fails.
